sentences.sContent: The only way to catch mice is to set a trap .
sentences.sCn: 抓老鼠的唯一办法就是放置捕鼠器。

sentences.sContent: He stepped into a bear trap covered in snow.
sentences.sCn: 他踩到了埋在雪里的一个捕熊夹。

sentences.sContent: Were you just trying to trap her into making some admission?
sentences.sCn: 你仅仅是在试图诱骗她招供吗？

sentences.sContent: ...Leah easily could have fallen into a trap of feeling content; instead...

synos.tran: 诱捕；使…受限制；使…陷入困境

phrases.pCn: 疏水阀；疏水器；汽水分离器；凝汽阀
[建]天窗；陷阱门；[建]地板或屋顶上的活门
气体收集器；气体分离器；气阱
恶作剧；[军]诡雷；诱杀装置

words.tran: 捕获的；陷入困境的；收集的；受到限制的
设陷阱捕兽者；捕捉器；[矿业] 矿井风门开关管理员
诱捕（trap的ing形式）；设陷阱；阻止；使密封于管内

trans.tranOther: a piece of equipment for catching animals
If you trap someone into doing or saying something, you trick them so that they do or say it, although they did not want to
